description: Univerbation from all +‎ right. Compare Old English eallriht (“all-right, just, exactly”), equivalent to al- (“all”) +‎ right.

entries.meaning: (often proscribed) Alternative form of all right; satisfactory; okay; in acceptable order.
examples: Synonyms: acceptable, adequate, fine; see also Thesaurus:satisfactory

entries.meaning: (often proscribed) Alternative form of all right.
